node.title: Chinese official gets Interpol post despite opposition from Australian MPs
node.alt: A shot from above of a large dark meeting hall.
node.description: Interpol's member countries vote to appoint a Chinese public security official to the international law enforcement body's executive committee, despite objections from a group of Australian MPs and international human rights organisations.
node.content:
["A Chinese government official has been appointed to Interpol's executive committee, despite objections from a group of Australian MPs and international human rights organisations.", "The international law enforcement body\u00a0also elected a contentious official from the United Arab Emirates as its new president during its annual general assembly held on Thursday in Turkey.", "Hu Binchen, an official at China's Ministry of Public Security, was elected to join Interpol's executive committee as a delegate from Asia.", "Mr Hu was backed by China's government, which has been accused of using the global police body to hunt down exiled dissidents and of disappearing its citizens.", "Foreign Ministry spokesperson Zhao Lijian said China was making the world a safer place by \"recommending appropriate candidates to run for the executive committee membership\".", "Earlier this week, six Australian MPs and senators signed an Inter-Parliamentary Alliance on China (IPAC) letter urging Interpol members to block Mr Hu's\u00a0election over concerns that Beijing uses Interpol's red notice system to target exiled activists.", "Liberal Party Senator Concetta Fierravanti-Wells, who was among the signatories, said her greatest concern was the possibility China would use Interpol as a vehicle for its repressive policies and harm Interpol's international standing.", "The Lyon, France-based agency acts as an intermediary for national police services seeking to hunt down suspects outside of their borders.", "Its\u00a0charter is supposed to prevent the use of police notices for political reasons.", "
Interpol's new leader\u00a0
", "Interpol's incoming president is Major\u00a0General\u00a0Ahmed Naser al-Raisi, the inspector general at the United Arab Emirates' Interior Ministry, who has\u00a0been accused by human rights groups of involvement in torture and arbitrary detentions in the UAE.", "Interpol said\u00a0Major\u00a0General al-Raisi was elected on Thursday\u00a0to a four-year term following three rounds of voting and received 68.9 per cent\u00a0of the votes cast in the final round.", "", "
Major General Ahmed Nasser al-Raisi has been accused of complicity with torture and human rights violations in the United Arab Emirates.(Interpol)
", "\"Interpol is an indispensable organisation built on the strength of its partnerships,\" Interpol quoted him as saying.\u00a0", "The vote for president was closely watched since the first-ever Chinese president of the body, Meng Hongwei, vanished midway through his four-year term on a return trip to China in 2018.", "It subsequently emerged that he had been detained and accused of bribery and other alleged crimes.", "", "
Ali Ahmad and Matthew Hedges say they were tortured by Emirati security forces.(Reuters: Yesim Dikmen)
", "Major\u00a0General al-Raisi is accused of torture and has criminal complaints against him in five countries, including in France, where Interpol has its headquarters, and in Turkey, where the election was held.", "His election drew angry responses from the two Britons who filed the complaints.", "\"This is a sad day for international justice and global policing,\" said Matthew Hedges, a British doctoral student who was imprisoned in the UAE for nearly seven months in 2018 on spying charges. Mr\u00a0Hedges says he was subjected to torture and months of solitary confinement.", "Ali Issa Ahmad, a soccer fan who says he was tortured by the UAE security agency during the 2019 Asia Cup soccer tournament said: \"I will not stop my fight for justice for the torture and abuse I suffered under al-Raisi's watch. I hope that Interpol will not allow him to abuse any other people.\"", "Their lawyer, Rodney Dixon, said his clients would \"redouble their efforts to seek justice for their torture and pursue Major General\u00a0al-Raisi in national courts wherever he travels in his new position\".", "Mr Hedges was pardoned by UAE President Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan, but Emirati officials still insist Mr Hedges was spying for Britain's MI6 intelligence agency, without offering definitive proof to support their claims.", "He, his family and British diplomats have repeatedly denied the charges.", "Sayed Ahmed Alwadaei, an activist with the Bahrain Institute for Rights and Democracy, warned Major General al-Raisi's election \"represents the beginning of a dangerous era, with authoritarian regimes now able to dictate international policing\".", "\"No one is safe from the abuse of Interpol and authoritarian regimes,\" Mr Alwadaei said in a statement.", "Major General al-Raisi replaces Kim Jong Yan from South Korea, a vice-president who was swiftly elected as a replacement to serve out the rest of Mr Meng's term.", "Although Interpol's secretary-general runs Interpol on a day-to-day basis, the president plays a role in supervising the police body's work and guiding its overall general direction.", "The president chairs Interpol's general assemblies and meetings of its executive committee.", "Juergen Stock of Germany currently holds the post of secretary-general.", "About 470 police chiefs, ministers and other representatives from more than 160 countries attended the three-day meeting. Each country attending has one vote.", "ABC/AP"]
